moves.1... e5 2. g3: I love this opening it allows a quick castle and creates attacking and defensive power on the board
moves.3... Bc5: lining up for a quick mate
moves.4... d6: Bishop on C5 is now out on a limb
moves.5. Ne2: sticking with the game plan to get my knight and bishop out early
moves.5... Bg4: no need to take it but it needs re-enforced so rook over to f1
moves.7... Bb6: bishop under threat from the pawn so withdrawn to b6
moves.9. b3: still working to get my counter attack in play
moves.9... Qe7: lack of options means the queen retreats to a strengthen the defence and leave it less vunerable
moves.10. d4: right this is the start of my counter-attack
moves.10... exd4 11. cxd4 f6: I am now holding the centre, choices choices
moves.12. d5: ok attack the bishop it has to retreat
moves.13. f4: not sure if this was quite necessary in the grand scheme of the game but ok no harm done
moves.13... h6: again the black is waiting for my attack tries to create a better defensive formation
moves.14. Bb2: B to b2 to open up a line of fire to h8
moves.14... Nd7: sensible move by black getting the knight into play
moves.15... Bc5: there that black bishop again still out on a limb
moves.16... Bb4: should he have taken the bishop perhaps but it now prevents me moving my knight on d2
moves.18. Nxc3 c6 19. Qe2: anticipating the pawn taking d5 and then leaving e5 unable to counter take as the queen would have me in check, so move my white queen to e2
moves.19... g6 20. O-O-O: now I have power down the middle on d e and f
moves.20... Rc8: anticipating a weak point in my defence with the knight on c3 and king on c1
moves.21. Nc4: second knight moves into attacking role as the pawn on a5 is now unsupported
moves.21... c5 22. Nb5: building the knight attack this becomes clearer shortly
moves.22... h5: black is all bunged up so resorts to moving the pawn to h5 to try and create more manoeuvring space
moves.24. Nb5: bit of a wasted journey that
moves.24... Nf8: knight moves to f8 lots of congestion on blacks back row
moves.25. Ncxd6+: what I should have done 2 moves ago
moves.25... Kd8: the black knight is a problem to the forthcoming attack so it needs to get dealt with kxbf7
moves.27... Rb8: black decides not to defend pawn for pawn
moves.29. Nd6: knight then attacks, was that why he positioned his rook behind the pawn on b7?
moves.29... Qe7: unhappy queen moves to the only safe spot
moves.30. Nf7+: nice check supported by the pawn
moves.31. Nxh8 Qg7: queen still not happy want to kill the knight
moves.32. d6: tactically it helps me if the queen takes the knight at this point as I want the queen on row 8 not row 7
moves.33. e7: still charging ahead with the brave pawn
moves.33... Nxe7: knight has enough and kills the brave pawn
moves.34. Qxe7: big lunge forward by the queen to e7
moves.36. Qxb8: king moves to save the queen
moves.37... Kf5: king in a desperate hope flees but his own pawns are blocking an escape
moves.38. Qc8+:
a resignation, no point in losing both the queen and king, they are captured to fight another day

Well I do hope you enjoyed my annotation.  I tried to make it as humorous as possible.  I will also try to get better with my shorthand chess although I almost prefer the full narrative
